nodes.bodyText: Calling Thread.interrupt() here would be good to avoid blocking shutdown sequence.
Is this idempotent? Retrying this call might create multiple tasks?

retryOnRateLimit only retry when ThrottleException (rate limit) happen. It mean API request is not accepted at that time. So only one api call is accepted.
In this case, we don't take care on multi task in my understand.
I guess this is idempotent, but can you check if it's okay to call this twice or more just in case?
same as above comment. Only one api call will be accepted.
Returning null would be a bit better? I guess it'll be handled as T=Void in this case
I don't have a strong opinion on this, but I think this can be an instance variable.
This can be replaced with Math.min(baseIncrementalSecs * i, rateLimitMaxBaseWaitSecs)
Do you think it's a good idea to collect metrics of this retry over cases?

I guess it is rare case that we can't resolve rate limit error with retry finally so far.
Currently I don't think it is needed.
But it is better to introduce some metrics related on CommandExecutor to improve monitoring in the future.
